name: American Gyros
author: Chef John
summary: Authentic Greek gyros are made with pork and chicken, but I prefer this version. It uses the same spices but is made with ground lamb and/or beef. Plus it's perfect for making ahead of time and heating it when you make your gyros. Don't forget to make tzatziki!
ingredients: ½ cup finely diced yellow onion
2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line with parchment paper that extends up the sides
Turn the parchment paper over so the oiled side is up
Place ground lamb and beef in a mixing bowl
Add onions, garlic, rosemary, oregano, salt, pepper, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and bread crumbs
Transfer to prepared baking dish and press the meat mixture firmly into the dish in an even layer that extends to the edges
Meat mixture should be packed and fairly dense
Bake in preheated oven until nicely browned, 40 to 45 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, 1 to 2 hours
Transfer meat to a cutting board
Slice each piece into 1/8-inch thick slices as you need them
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Cook slices until browned, about 2 minutes per side
